Entries.default:
A wet, heavy thud draws your attention to a figure standing atop the icy cliff. Light glints off of the cleaver he holds readied overhead.

The blade arcs downward, evoking a fine red mist that hangs upon the frigid air.
"It is you! Come at last!"
"Gótvadhjur, fellow traveler! A day of glory this turns out to be! First, auspices of a visitation, then the arrival of the Duskspeaker!"
"What's the Call of Winter?"
"You speak of the foretold beginning of the ending of all things at Rymrgand's touch."
"Yes. He invited me, then he told you I was coming. Quite the prophecy."
"Those of us blessed by Rymrgand hear the Call of Winter in our waking and sleeping lives - it is what has called us to this place... and what has called you!"
"You know, the Final Chorus. The Lure of Nothing? The Dusk of Being?"
"Vatnir, our mentor, foretold your coming. He described you perfectly, from toes to top! Praise be to Rymrgand!"
The man squints down at the paper before nodding vigorously.
"Come in, Duskspeaker, come in! Be sure to speak with our mentor Vatnir - he's down in the chapel in the middle of the settlement."
"Thaw the meat and uncask the beer! The Duskspeaker has arrived!"
"Rymrgand has blessed this outpost with a messenger. It appears for but minutes at a time yet is a thing of great beauty!"
[Show the invitation.] "Vatnir's the one who sent me this letter."
"I don't suppose you can tell me about this iceberg."
"Did you see the ships? We came on them. Back then, that was the extent of the ice. But now it stretches to the horizon! It grows further each day!"
"I'm not interested in your endings, happy or otherwise."
"And yet you cannot avoid them, Duskspeaker. Is it not wiser to embrace what comes? Or at the very least, attempt to understand it?"
"What... what is happening? How could this happen?"
"What does it all mean?"
"Where is Vatnir? Someone find Vatnir!"
"Greetings."
[Say nothing.]
"It is me! How kind of you to notice!"
"Drop the weapon!"
"Truly, I hear the Call of Winter!"
"Weapon?" He looks up at the cleaver.
"Oh! No, this is but a tool. For cleaning and gutting!" He grabs up the headless remains of a fish and hoists them in grisly display.
"I have so little idea what you're talking about that I don't know where to start."
The elf blinks at you.
"Visitation? Are you talking about me?"
"Go, go. Vatnir awaits!"
"Please, please - drink, eat, be merry!"
"The Beast returns!"
"Is he... dead? Can death die?"
The kith straightens as his gaze finds you, and he fixes you with a single pointed finger from a bloodstained hand.
Ydwin glances askance at you.
"The part in each of us that knows when the end is coming, that point after which struggle is meaningless and what remains is only prelude to naught."
"No matter! Who among us truly understands the will of the gods?"
"This one speaks of the Lure of Nothing. The Dusk of Being. The ending of all things and the part of the soul that longs for that ending."
"These concepts are central to more... traditionalist understandings of Rymrgand's designs."

"Right cheery, that."

His words elicit a faint smile from Ydwin.
"I'll be on my way."
"Wait! No! At least come in and speak with Vatnir! Our days are numbered, yours and ours alike! Come and celebrate the dance we're set to!"
"Come, come!" He beckons you in.
"He is very wise." The kith nods vigorously.
Ydwin chuckles quietly.
"You should speak with Vatnir, the teacher of this encampment. He'll be in the old chapel up the hill."
"It means so much to us that you're here."
"No, no..." He laughs.
"Fejin haemkamür, brother!"
"But you are of the Land..."
<link="neutralvalue://Ordhjóma: Let's make the best of it, yes?">"Jerüm dáth jott ur dhessü, ja?"</link>
"Auspices of a visitation and the return of the Duskspeaker? Truly a day of glory this!"
"Did you just call me the Duskspeaker?"
"Can't fault your hearing!"
"The messenger returns."
"That doesn't strike you as a problem?"
"Of course not! Why would it?"
"Oh. So crazy talk."
"You made even less sense than the man in the blood-spattered hood."
"Thanks for the explanation."
She crosses her arms and says nothing further.
"What does it all mean?"
